definition: to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses

sentences.english: Do you still recall the frightful night we crossed the Rio Grande?
sentences.chinese: 你还记得我们穿过边疆铁骑军，那个可怕的晚上吗？

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants, found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的铁骑军忽然觉得自己被攻了。

sentences.english: But German team's first competition poured under the Australian team's cavalries .
sentences.chinese: 而德国队的首场比赛则倒在了澳大利亚队的铁骑之下。

sentences.english: His famous "Ironside" cavalry and New Model Army defeated the king.
sentences.chinese: 他著名的铁骑军和新模范军击败了国王。

sentences.english: Sixty cannons and the thirteen squares darted lightning point-blank on the cuirassiers.
sentences.chinese: 六十尊大炮和十三个方阵同时向着铁骑军劈面射来。

sentences.english: All at once, the cuirassiers, who had been the assailants , found themselves assailed.
sentences.chinese: 那些攻人的铁骑军突然觉得自己被攻了。

sentences.english: Our steeds galloped at the Great Pass as autumn winds blow.
sentences.chinese: 在雄关旁，我们的铁骑在秋风中驰骋。

sentences.english: The cuirassiers had not succeeded, since the centre was not broken through.
sentences.chinese: 铁骑军丝毫没有成功，由于他们并没有突破中部防线。

definition: the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)
Outer Mongolia (lit. north of the Gobi Desert)
